com.yahoo.memory

Class WritableBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yahoo.memory.Buffer
      • com.yahoo.memory.WritableBuffer

  • public abstract class WritableBuffer
extends Buffer
    Provides read and write, positional primitive and primitive array access to any of the four resources mentioned at the package level.
    Author:
    Lee Rhodes

    • Method Summary

      Creates on-heap WritableBuffer with the given capacity
      abstract WritableMemory asWritableMemory()
      Convert this WritableBuffer to a WritableMemory
      abstract void clear()
      Clears all bytes of this Buffer from position to limit to zero
      abstract void clearBits(byte bitMask)
      Clears the bits defined by the bitMask
      abstract boolean compareAndSwapLong(long expect, long update)
      Atomically sets the current value at the memory location to the given updated value if and only if the current value == the expected value.

      Fills this Buffer from position to limit with the given byte value.

                                              long capacityBytes)

      • getAndAddLong

        public abstract long getAndAddLong(long delta)
        Atomically adds the given value to the long located at offsetBytes.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the modified value

      • compareAndSwapLong

        public abstract boolean compareAndSwapLong(long expect,
                                           long update)
        Atomically sets the current value at the memory location to the given updated value if and only if the current value == the expected value.
        Parameters:
        expect - the expected value
        update - the new value
        Returns:
        true if successful. False return indicates that the current value at the memory location was not equal to the expected value.

      • getAndSetLong

        public abstract long getAndSetLong(long newValue)
        Atomically exchanges the given value with the current value located at offsetBytes.
        Parameters:
        newValue - new value
        Returns:
        the previous value

      • getArray

        public abstract Object getArray()
        Returns the primitive backing array, otherwise null.
        Returns:
        the primitive backing array, otherwise null.

        Clears all bytes of this Buffer from position to limit to zero

      • clearBits

        public abstract void clearBits(byte bitMask)
        Clears the bits defined by the bitMask
        Parameters:
        bitMask - the bits set to one will be cleared

        public abstract void fill(byte value)

        Parameters:

        public abstract void setBits(byte bitMask)
        Sets the bits defined by the bitMask
        Parameters:
        bitMask - the bits set to one will be set
